channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Work putting in pavements on A435 alongside the new building site at Nortenham Allotments has been completed fir many months but a long line of traffic cones are still on the main road for no apparent reason., 17th September
item.description:
Many traffic cones on road alongside the main road A435 which are not required as pavement works have been completed and entrance to the site is closed and no access needed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Please reply to my email query, 17th September
item.description:
I sent a query in via your form 3/8/25 Web Reference: HCF004050 Enquiry Number: 11491640 And followed up on 7/9/25 Web Reference: HCF004522 Enquiry Number: 11493833 I have heard nothing back. The speed bump here is insufficient as large vehicles do not slow down causing houses on the end of the street to rattle due to speed. Can you increase the size of this speed bump or implement more measure to slow traffic down. I think more calming measures or expansion of the speed bump would help.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 117, Arle Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Street light mot working 3 wendercliff road, 17th September
item.description:
To the right of 3 wendercliff road that lights the alleyway to my back gate at 10 & 12 gorse road been like it a few days. I use the alleyway to get out my house and now it's getting dark and there is a big bush blocking the alleyway it's hard to see and there is a danger of falling in the dark
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Wendercliff Close, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path blocked by crops, hedge and fences, 16th September
item.description:
The public footpath across the corner of the field is blocked by a thick hedge with no gate or style at the north east point of this section of path, and a ploughed and planted field and another fence with no access om the south west section of this path

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The public footpath is completely blocked by a fence and hedge, 16th September
item.description:
The public footpath between Home Farm and the M5 is inaccessible due to a fence and hedge directly across the route.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Small but dangerous sink hole in road, 16th September
item.description:
Deep sink hole in pavement, some bright spark filled it with sand a few months ago, very dangerous Today a lady fell in the street and cut her wrists because itâ€™s very hard to see. Can someone fix it rather than filling with sand please!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, High Street, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Man hole grill had fallen into the manhole, 16th September
item.description:
On the south side of Swindon Lane approaching from the racecourse the manhole frame has been damaged and the grill or grate had fallen into the manhole creating a serious problem. I reported it to the traffic management chap who repositioned it. However it could fall in again as the hinge has been damaged. I suggest a complete replacement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Swindon Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen tree, obstructing the pavement,, 16th September
item.description:
A tree has fallen from heavy winds and is now obstructing the pavement, forcing pedestrians to walk on the road. This would primarily be an issue for the high schoolers and people walking dogs, travelling to and from schools and nurseries.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Beware multiple cars have now had flat tyres, 16th September
item.description:
On route to the Elkestone crossroads. This road has been closed for two weeks and they haven't used the opportunity to sort this abysmal stretch of road out. Council are terrible and cant think outside the box.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cockleford Road, Elkstone, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin full, 16th September
item.description:
By entrance to Lott's Meadow/ Burrows Field Please empty asap

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 107, Church Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 16th September
item.description:
Cllr to resident:These trees are probably either Highways trees or on the proposed new school site, so are a matter for Gloucestershire County Council. I will request highways and those looking after the proposed school development take a look I am contacting you about the trees in the cul-de-sac outside our house , number 20. I am concerned that they are dying and 1 in particular is about to fall. It is already leaning very low and I am concerned that if/when it does fall it will land on my car in my drive way or one of the children/families coming to our childminding business. If you could have it checked at you earliest convenience before it causes damage.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drains all the way down Cirencester Road from golf course to bridge are still blocked . Next time we have heavy rain it will flood again. Itâ€™s now doing to our property including our wall so we will have to claim, 16th September
item.description:
Water collects by bridge at 279 Cirencester Road as all the drains are blocked
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Worrying situation, 16th September
item.description:
The path here is quite spooky as it's getting darker, especially when you can hear the wind howling and owls hooting. perhaps some lighting might be beneficial so us walkers can enjoy our evening strolls. thanks. Glinda Withergar
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin full again, 16th September
item.description:
This bin is again full to overflowing. Lorry drivers use the road overnight which may be why it fills up quicker than you have scheduled to empty. Needs emptying more frequently as a lot of litter is blown around from it overflowing
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnett Way, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
